importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: This is the date when the news of Doug Martin's death was reported and when the Oakland Police Department and Mayor Barbara Lee issued public statements regarding the incident.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: This time frame indicates when the news story was updated and published, marking the dissemination of the event to the public.

keyTakeAways: Former NFL running back Doug Martin died after a struggle with police during a detention for suspected involvement in a home break-in in Oakland.
Martin, a 36-year-old former All-Pro with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, was unresponsive after being taken into custody and later died in a hospital; cause of death not yet released.
The incident occurred on a Saturday morning, with police stating there was a 'brief struggle' during the arrest.
Martin was a highly accomplished player, with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns over six seasons, and was named first-team All-Pro twice and selected to the Pro Bowl.
He was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Tampa Bay Buccaneers franchise history.
The Oakland Police Department and Mayor Barbara Lee expressed condolences to Martin’s family, emphasizing his status as an Oaklander with a distinguished public profile.
The case has raised broader concerns about police interactions with individuals during detentions and the potential for fatalities during such encounters.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, best known for his time with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died after a brief struggle with Oakland police during an investigation into a home break-in. The incident occurred on a Saturday morning, and Martin was transported to a hospital where he passed away at 36. His family has requested privacy, and the Oakland Police Department and Mayor Barbara Lee have expressed condolences, recognizing Martin as an Oaklander with a distinguished football legacy. Details about the cause of death are pending, with an autopsy underway. The event has sparked broader discussions about police interactions and safety during detentions.
title: Former NFL Player Doug Martin Dies After Police Detention
